properties.areaDesc: Yukon Delta; Lower Yukon Valley; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kuskokwim Valley; Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 2 at 5:14PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
Cold air over Canada will be pulled and pushed southwest into
Interior and Western Alaska through the weekend, and into the
middle next week, pushing temperatures below normal in the Western
Interior, Eastern Norton Sound, and the Lower Yukon Delta.

Temperatures will fall into the teens below to 30s below
Saturday, and into the 20s below to 40s below Sunday and Monday
before warming slowly the rest of the week. There is some
uncertainty as any clouds that move through the area will increase
temperatures locally 5 to 15 degrees. The coldest temperatures
are expected to be south of Huslia.

Residents can prepare by making sure they have cold weather gear
and extra supplies if planning to traveling.

For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.
